revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix (2), SK SK hynix → SK hynix (2)
revision.text:

|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = ARM926J |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 350 |cpu2chip1 = STMicro;STR711FR0; |cpu2_cores = |cpu2_type = |cpu2_type_rev = |cpu2spd = |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = SK hynix;HY27US08121A-TPCB; |flash1size = 64 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 64 |ram1chip = SK hynix;; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = |eth_none = true |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 2 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2.1 |pwr_barrel_len = 9.5 |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = touchscreen |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 10/16/2008 |estreldate = |estprice = 179.95 |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = Xterasys XN-3135G |rad1modif = USB |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Ralink;RT2571W; |rad1chip2 = Ralink;RT2528; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = unknown |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== [http://wiki.chumby.com/index.php/Main_Page Chumby Wiki] :CPU: [[Freescale]] Semiconductor [http://www.freescale.com/webapp/sps/site/prod_summary.jsp?code=i.MX21 i.MX21] - MC9328MX21 :The codename for the ''Chumby'' Classic is ''Ironforge''. The ''Chumby'' Classic has two external USB 2.0 ports and (per the FCC test report) one internal USB 1.1 port for the wireless module. ===FCC filing board (old Ironforge revision)=== "with love, -bunnie", the ''Chumby'' logo, "Ironforge V1."???, and "MADE IN U.S.A." is silkscreened on the main board in the FCC photos.
"Copyright (C)2006,2007", "Chumby Industries", "Some Rights Reserved, see", "http://www.chumby.com/legal/developer", and "Ironforge Daughtercard v1.2" is silkscreened on the daughtercard. :"KW5301" and "V1.3" is silkscreened on the wireless module. :KW5301 googlery yields ''KASDA'' as a possible manufacturer, however, :the FCC test report indicates the module was manufactured by ''TP-LINK'' ===Newer board (via pictures on [http://www.madox.net/blog/2011/01/04/3-generations-of-naked-chumbies/ madox.net])=== "with love, -bunnie", the ''Chumby'' logo, "Ironforge v1.7", and
"SETEC ASTRONOMY" is silkscreened on the mainboard. ==Links of Interest== *[http://wiki.chumby.com/index.php/Main_Page Chumby Wiki] *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2SQCFjfLciU '''In the Maker Shed: Chumby Guts kit''' on YouTube] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20080409203206/http://store.chumby.com/ Original retail price of $179.95] [[Category:English Documentation]]
